text: A variety (Kola Joha) of aromatic Joha rice of Assam Joha ( ') is a variety of rice grown in India, notable for its aroma, delicate and excellent taste. Assam is the largest cultivator of this rice, it is primarily grown through paddy field farming. In Garo Hills it's widely cultivated and it is known as Jaha rice or locally known as . == Varieties == There are various traditional types of joha rice available in Assam. Tulsi (তুলসী )Joha, Kola (ক’লা ) Joha, Rampal (ৰামপাল ) joha, Kunkuni (কুনকুনি )and Manki Joha. == See also == * List of rice varieties == References == * == External links == Category:Bengali cuisine Category:Rice varieties Category:Economy of Assam Category:Rice production in India Category:Flora of Assam
title: Joha rice
